publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3674 Mr Keith Raffan: Cairngorms National Park-That the Parliament welcomes the successful establishment of the Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park; looks forward to the establishment of Scotland's second national park in the Cairngorms; notes that highland Perthshire is a vital part of the coherent natural and cultural identity of the Cairngorms, and believes that the park boundary should include this area, as recommended by Scottish Natural Heritage and supported by the overwhelming majority of respondents to the Scottish Executive's consultation on the draft designation order and by the Rural Development Committee unanimously. Supported by: Murdo Fraser*, Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-3674 Cairngorms National Park (lodged on 3 December 2002) Mr David Davidson*, Mr Mike Rumbles*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mary Scanlon*, John Scott*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, David McLetchie*
S1M-3674 Cairngorms National Park (lodged on 3 December 2002) Mr Keith Raffan*, Robin Harper*, Fergus Ewing*, Mr Keith Harding*

S1M-3674 Mr Keith Raffan: Cairngorms National Park-That the Parliament welcomes the successful establishment of the Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park; looks forward to the establishment of Scotland's second national park in the Cairngorms; notes that highland Perthshire is a vital part of the coherent natural and cultural identity of the Cairngorms, and believes that the park boundary should include this area, as recommended by Scottish Natural Heritage and supported by the overwhelming majority of respondents to the Scottish Executive's consultation on the draft designation order and by the Rural Development Committee unanimously. Supported by: Murdo Fraser, Nora Radcliffe, Mr David Davidson, Mr Mike Rumbles, Mr Brian Monteith, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mary Scanlon, John Scott, Mr Kenneth Gibson, David McLetchie, Mr Keith Raffan, Robin Harper, Fergus Ewing, Mr Keith Harding
S1M-3674 Cairngorms National Park (lodged on 3 December 2002) Mr Jamie McGrigor*
S1M-3674 Cairngorms National Park (lodged on 3 December 2002) Mr John Swinney*
S1M-3674 Cairngorms National Park (lodged on 3 December 2002) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-3674 Cairngorms National Park (lodged on 3 December 2002) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
S1M-3674 Cairngorms National Park (lodged on 3 December 2002) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3674 Cairngorms National Park (lodged on 3 December 2002) Alasdair Morgan*
S1M-3674 Cairngorms National Park (lodged on 3 December 2002) Brian Adam*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-3674 Cairngorms National Park (lodged on 3 December 2002) George Lyon*

S1M-3674 Mr Keith Raffan: Cairngorms National Park—That the Parliament welcomes the successful establishment of the Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park; looks forward to the establishment of Scotland’s second national park in the Cairngorms; notes that highland Perthshire is a vital part of the coherent natural and cultural identity of the Cairngorms, and believes that the park boundary should include this area, as recommended by Scottish Natural Heritage and supported by the overwhelming majority of respondents to the Scottish Executive’s consultation on the draft designation order and by the Rural Development Committee unanimously. Supported by: Murdo Fraser, Nora Radcliffe, Mr David Davidson, Mr Mike Rumbles, Mr Brian Monteith, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mary Scanlon, John Scott, Mr Kenneth Gibson, David McLetchie, Mr Keith Raffan, Robin Harper, Fergus Ewing, Mr Keith Harding, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr John Swinney, Tommy Sheridan, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Donald Gorrie, Alasdair Morgan, Brian Adam, Dorothy-Grace Elder, George Lyon
